meanings.definition: The action of rotating like a helicopter rotor.
meanings.sent1: The helicoptering of the toy helicopter amazed the children at the park.
meanings.sent2: The helicopter's helicoptering was smooth and steady as it flew overhead.
meanings.sent3: The paper helicopter's helicoptering made it look like a tiny flying machine.
meanings.sent4: The helicoptering of the windmill blades created a mesmerizing sight in the field.
meanings.sent5: The helicoptering of the maple seed as it fell to the ground was a fascinating sight.

meanings.definition: The act of hovering or moving in a manner similar to a helicopter.
meanings.sent1: The helicoptering of the dragonfly caught the attention of the curious child.
meanings.sent2: The helicopter's smooth helicoptering allowed it to stay in one spot effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The toy helicopter's helicoptering around the room made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The helicoptering of the hummingbird as it fed on nectar was a graceful sight.
meanings.sent5: The helicoptering of the kite in the sky brought joy to the children playing in the park.

meanings.definition: To spin or rotate rapidly like a helicopter blade.
meanings.sent1: She was helicoptering the jump rope so fast that it blurred before our eyes.
meanings.sent2: The helicopter blades were helicoptering above us as we watched in awe.
meanings.sent3: He helicoptered the basketball on his finger, showing off his skills.
meanings.sent4: The leaves helicoptered down from the tree in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's skirt helicoptered around her as she twirled on stage.
